translated: The Mansion of the Thirty-Three🔽The Divine Maiden
The Cittalatā Mansion
The Divine Maiden Soṇadinnā🔽“Divine maiden, you stand there
with surpassing beauty,
Shining on all directions,

analyzed: osadhī viya tārakā  kena tetādisaḥ vaṇṇaḥ
translated: like a medicinal herb, a star.🔽What is the cause of your beauty?
What is the cause of your radiance?
What are the riches that arise
that are so dear to the mind?
I ask you, divine maiden of great splendor,
what merit did you make as a human?
By what are you so radiant?

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: Your beauty shines in all directions.”
The deity, satisfied,

analyzed: moggallānena pucchitā  pañham puṭṭhā viyākā asi
translated: asked by Moggallāna,🔽answered the question
of the result of that deed:
“They knew me as Soṇadinnā,
a lay follower in Nāḷandā.
I was endowed with faith and virtue,
always delighting in sharing.
I gave clothing, food,
and lodging with a lamp,
to those who were upright
with a serene mind.
On the fourteenth, fifteenth,
and eighth of the fortnight,
and the fortnight of the miracle,
endowed with the eight factors.
I always observed the Uposatha,
always restrained in the precepts;
I was controlled, and shared,
I lived in a divine mansion.
I refrained from killing living creatures,
and was restrained from false speech;
I was free from stealing and from sexual activity,
and far from drinking alcohol.
I delighted in the five training rules,
I was skilled in the noble truths;
I was a lay follower of the Visionary,
of the famous Gotama.
Because of that I have such a complexion,

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca me sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and my complexion shines in all directions.”
The Story of Soṇadinnā’s Heavenly Mansion is the sixth.
